label: GoControl GC-TBZ48
info_overview: The Z-Wave Thermostat (GC-TBZ48) is a programmable, Z-Wave communications thermostat. It can be powered using 24VAC (if both “R”&”C”wires are available at the thermostat), or using four (4) AA batteries. Using Z-Wave technology, end users have the ability to use the 2GIG Go!Control panel to control the thermostat, configure programming settings, as well as to display current conditions in the home or office.
info_inclusion:
1. Set your primary controller to Include, add or Install mode, to add the thermostat as a node on your network (see your controller’s user manual for detailed instructions).
  2. Press any button to take thermostat out of sleep mode.
  3. Press and hold FAN button for 5 seconds. SETUP will be displayed in the status display line.
  4. Scroll to “Z-Wave” using up/down buttons. Press SELECT.
  5. When prompted by your Z-Wave controller, Press the YES button in the Z-Wave Install screen.
  6. Press SELECT (mode button) to add thermostat to network.
  7. Display line should flash WAIT then SUCCESS if Z-Wave connection is made.
  8. If Z-Wave does not connect to controller, WAIT, then FAIL will flash in status display line.
  9. If thermostat fails to connect, repeat Steps three (3) through (7) to re-try connecting.
info_exclusion:
1. Set your primary controller to Include, add or Install mode, to add the thermostat as a node on your network (see your controller’s user manual for detailed instructions).
  2. Press any button to take thermostat out of sleep mode.
  3. Press and hold FAN button for 5 seconds. SETUP will be displayed in the status display line.
  4. Scroll to “Z-Wave” using up/down buttons. Press SELECT.
  5. When prompted by your Z-Wave controller, Press the YES button in the Z-Wave Install screen.
  6. Press SELECT (mode button) to add thermostat to network.
  7. Display line should fl ash WAIT then SUCCESS if Z-Wave connection is made.
  8. If Z-Wave does not connect to controller, WAIT, then FAIL will flash in status display line.

parameters.label: Fan Type
parameters.overview:
• 0 = Gas (no fan w/Heat)
  • 1 = Electric (Fan w/Heat)

parameters.label: Minimum Off Time
parameters.overview: Sets the Minimum Off Time (MOT) delay before another heating/cooling cycle can begin

parameters.label: Minimum Run Time
parameters.overview: Sets the Minimum Run Time (MRT) delay before a heating/cooling cycle can turn off

parameters.label: Setpoint H/C Delta
parameters.overview: Sets the minimum separation between heating and cooling setpoints

parameters.label: H Delta Stage 1 ON
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 heating starts

parameters.label: H Delta Stage 1 OFF
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 heating stops

parameters.label: H Delta Stage 2 ON
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 heating starts

parameters.label: H Delta Stage 2 OFF
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 heating stops

parameters.label: H Delta Aux ON
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 3 heating starts

parameters.label: H Delta Stage 3 OFF
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 3 heating stops

parameters.label: C Delta Stage 1 ON
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 cooling starts

parameters.label: C Delta Stage 1 OFF
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 1 cooling stops

parameters.label: C Delta Stage 2 ON
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 cooling starts

parameters.label: C Delta Stage 2 OFF
parameters.overview: Sets the delta from setpoint that stage 2 cooling stops

parameters.label: Lifeline Association Group Report To Send
parameters.description: Lifeline Association Group Report To Send
parameters.overview:
Report to send to the Lifeline Association Group upon change in thermostat state. 

Bitmask values:

  • 1 = Temperature
  • 2 = Heat Setpoint
  • 4 = Cool Setpoint
  • 8 = Thermostat Heat/Cooling Mode
  • 16 = Fan Mode
  • 32 = Fan State
  • 64 = Operating State
  • 128 = Schedule (send CC parameter 38)
  • 256 = Setback (send CC parameter 40)
  • 512 = Run Hold (send CC parameter 39)
  • 1024 = Display Lock (send CC parameter 24)
  • 8192 = Battery Level
  • 16834 = Mechanical Relay State (send CC parameter 21)
  • 32768 = Thermostat State Config (send CC parameter 22)

parameters.label: Backlight Timer
parameters.overview: Sets the time from last button press that the backlight will turn OFF

parameters.label: Max Heat Setpoint
parameters.overview: Sets the maximum heating setpoint value

parameters.label: Min Cool Setpoint
parameters.overview: Sets the minimum cooling setpoint value

parameters.label: Schedule Enable
parameters.overview: Enable or disable thermostat's local scheduler

parameters.label: Run/Hold Mode
parameters.overview: 0 = Hold, 1 = Run

parameters.label: Un-Occupied HSP
parameters.overview: Heat Setpoint for Unoccupied mode

parameters.label: Un-Occupied CSP
parameters.overview: Cool Setpoint for Unoccupied mode

parameters.label: Remote Sensor 1 Node Number
parameters.overview: Node number for Remote Sensor 1

parameters.label: Remote Sensor 1 Temperature
parameters.overview: Temperature of Remote Sensor 1

parameters.label: Internal Sensor Temp Offset
parameters.overview: Internal Sensor Temperature Offset

parameters.label: R1 Sensor Temp Offset
